wikipedia_page.main: Guy Richard Pedder (7 July 1892 – 6 April 1964) was an English cricketer active in the 1910s, 1920s and early 1930s. Born at Brandiston Hall in Brandiston, Norfolk, Pedder was a right-handed batsman who played as a wicket-keeper who played the majority of his cricket in minor counties cricket, though he did make five appearances in first-class cricket.
